stimulusHtml:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

 

A manufacturer conducted a study to investigate whether a certain dental treat is effective in reducing the accumulation of plaque on the teeth of cats. The manufacturer randomly selected 30 cats from a cat sanctuary for the study. At the beginning of the study, each of the 30 cats had its teeth scored on a scale from 0 to 10, with lower values indicating less plaque. The cats were then given the treats on a strict schedule, and after one month each cat had its teeth scored again using the same technique. All other variables were held constant over the one month period. The difference in the scores (before treat minus after treat) was recorded, and the results are shown in the following dotplot.

(a) Explain what a positive difference indicates in the context of the study.

(b) Based only on the sample data in the dotplot, should the treat be used to reduce the accumulation of plaque on cat teeth? Explain your reasoning in the context of the study. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The owner of the sanctuary will purchase the treat for all of her cats if the manufacturer can provide convincing statistical evidence that it is effective in reducing plaque accumulation on cat teeth in one month or less.

(c) State, in words, the hypotheses of the appropriate test the manufacturer should use to investigate whether the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that the treat is effective in reducing plaque accumulation on cat teeth in one month or less.

(d) Assuming all conditions for the appropriate test are met, the manufacturer reported a p-value very close to 0 for the test. Based on the p-value and α=0.05 would the owner of the sanctuary purchase the treat? Justify your answer.

Consider a scenario in which 4 cats are randomly selected one at a time, with replacement, from the sample of 30 cats. Let the random variable C represent the number of cats out of the 4 selected with a positive difference in teeth score.

(e) Calculate and interpret the value of μC in the context of the scenario.
(f) Describe how the scenario could be modified to make C a geometric random variable.
